Oh yes there is power in the blood of Jesus. May His blood continue to avail for us all in Jesus Name. Blood of Jesus cover us. Blood of Jesus avail for us. Blood of Jesus wash our hearts in Jesus Name. Amen. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Amen. Peace!!!

This hymn is written by John G. Foote with E. A. H., who is probably Elisha A. Hoffman. Based on Exo 12:13 ------------------- The last 2 lines of each stanza are a bit different in the original: 1. Christ our Redeemer died on the cross, Died for the sinner, paid all his due; All who receive Him need never fear, Yes, He will pass, will pass over you. ----------- 2 Chiefest of sinners, Jesus will save; As He has promised, so He will do; Oh, sinner, hear Him, trust in His Word, Then He will pass, will pass over you. ------------ 3 Judgment is coming, all will be there. Who have rejected, who have refused? Oh, sinner, hasten, let Jesus in, Oh, He will pass, will pass over you. ---------- 4 O great compassion! O boundless love! Jesus hath power, Jesus is true; All who believe are safe from the storm, Oh, He will pass, will pass over you.

Indeed there is power in the blood of Jesus. May this blood continue to avail for us all in Jesus Name. Blood of Jesus cover us. Blood of Jesus avail for us. Blood of Jesus wash our hearts in Jesus Name. Amen.

Great hymn! Ever green any time, any day! i knew this hymn as a child living with my father when he used to play it on his turn-table stereo. But today, I was in my office working when the song started ringing in my heart. hence I went online in search for it - with the lyrics of the first line, and found it, and I had to use my ear-piece connected to my computer to listen to this great hymn. It's wonderful, heart-warming and soul-inspiring! i thank God Almighty - who despite our sins and limitations, deemed it necessary to sacrifice His only begotten Son - Jesus Christ on the cross, for the atonememt of our sins. i pray that God Almighty - by His Holy Spirit will give all of us the grace to serve Him in spirit and in truth, in purity, holiness and righteousness, and help us to make heaven at last in the mighty name of Jesus Christ - Amen!
Much more then, being now justified by His blood... I am kept saved by His life. I am reconciled by His life. Amen. and Amen.
Thanking Jesus for sacrificing Himself to provide the requirement for my atonement. This is a song of assurance. Am happy.
So appreciate the inclusion of this great stand-by hymn of confidence for the sinner!

First Corinthians 5 tells us that Christ is our Passover (v. 7). He is the Passover lamb. When those in Christianity use the passover lamb for gospel preaching, they always stress the blood. We have a good hymn, the chorus of which says, "When I see the blood,...I will pass over you" (Hymns, #1005). But we need to see that with the passover lamb there is something in addition to the blood. That is the meat. The blood had to be shed, and the meat of the lamb had to be eaten. The striking of the blood was for the eating of the meat. They applied the blood to the house, and then in the house they ate. The striking of the blood was not the goal; the eating of the meat was. Christ is the real Passover lamb, and He has been sacrificed for us, not only to redeem us but also to satisfy us. His blood redeemed us, and His life satisfies us.
Source: The Collected Works of Witness Lee, 1972, Volume 3, The Greatest Prophecy in the Bible and Its Fulfillment, ch. 6.
